skill.name: nft-standards
skill.description: Implement NFT standards (ERC-721, ERC-1155) with proper metadata handling, minting strategies, and marketplace integration. Use when creating NFT contracts, building NFT marketplaces, or implementing digital asset systems.

security_audit.summary: No data access, network calls, or execution logic are present. The skill is documentation and code examples only. No malicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Implement NFT standards with ERC-721 and ERC-1155
content.value_statement: NFT builders need clear guidance on standards, metadata, and minting. This skill provides practical patterns for contracts and marketplace readiness.
actual_capabilities: Explain ERC-721 and ERC-1155 design choices and tradeoffs
Describe off-chain and on-chain metadata formats and fields
Outline minting strategies with supply limits and pricing
Cover royalty implementation with EIP-2981 patterns
Provide patterns for soulbound and dynamic NFT behavior
limitations: Does not deploy contracts or run chain transactions
Does not perform security audits of user code
Does not generate or upload media assets
Does not integrate with specific marketplace APIs

use_cases.title: Choose a token standard
use_cases.description: Compare ERC-721 and ERC-1155 to pick the right model for a new collection.

use_cases.title: Define metadata schema
use_cases.description: Design metadata fields that are compatible with major NFT marketplaces.

use_cases.title: Design multi-token items
use_cases.description: Plan ERC-1155 items with supply caps and minting controls.

prompt_templates.title: Pick a standard
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend ERC-721 or ERC-1155 for a 5,000 item art collection and explain key implications.

prompt_templates.title: Metadata fields
prompt_templates.prompt: List the required and optional metadata fields for NFTs with IPFS metadata, plus best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Royalties setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to implement EIP-2981 royalties and common fee limits.

prompt_templates.title: Dynamic NFT plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a dynamic NFT design that updates metadata based on on-chain state changes.

output_examples.input: Help me design an ERC-1155 collection for a game with three item types and supply limits.
output: Use ERC-1155 with fixed IDs per item type to enable batch minting.
Set a max supply map for each ID and enforce it in mint functions.
Publish metadata with {id}.json and include attributes for rarity and power.

best_practices: Use OpenZeppelin implementations for standard compliance
Keep metadata consistent and pin IPFS assets
Document minting limits and royalty settings
anti_patterns: Mixing ERC-721 and ERC-1155 logic in one contract without a clear reason
Storing large metadata on-chain without cost justification
Using mutable metadata without a clear policy

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides guidance and examples that work in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What are the limits of the guidance?
faq.answer: It does not execute deployments or test contracts. It focuses on design and patterns.

faq.question: Can it integrate with OpenSea or other marketplaces?
faq.answer: It explains standards and metadata, but it does not call marketplace APIs.

faq.question: Does it access my files or keys?
faq.answer: No, it is a static skill with no file or network access.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot metadata not displaying?
faq.answer: Check JSON field names, IPFS pinning status, and tokenURI formatting.

faq.question: How does it compare to a full audit tool?
faq.answer: It provides design guidance, not automated testing or security auditing.
